issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body: Looks like the findbugs has increased from 160 to 165. We should resolve this ASAP.
Patch that enables findbugs exclude for the hadoop-mapreduce-client modules.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12500955/MAPREDUCE-3209.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 9 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed the unit tests build

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1153//testReport/

Not sure why this is causing test failure with autoreconf. The patch isnt related. Let me try a dummy patch.
Attaching a dummy patch to see how the tests react on the hudson bot.

Looks like autoreconf isnt installed on the build machines. I have pinged Giri to help fix issues on the build machines. I am going to go ahead and commit this, so that we atleast get findbugs under control.
Just committed this. Added it to HADOOP-7741 for being backported to 0.23.
